isis.stitle: HEAT VENTILATION AIR CONDITIONING (HVAC), Thermostatic Expansion Valve (TXV) System, March 2007 and Later - REMOVE AND INSTALL - THERMOSTATIC EXPANSION VALVE

svcprocinfo.para: Depending on the vehicle model/engine combination, replacement of specific A/C refrigerant components may require the removal of nearby assemblies (right splash panel, cab cowl tray, etc) to gain access to the components or related A/C lines. Refer to the appropriate section(s) in the Master Service Manual for additional procedures.

item.para: The cab cowl tray exists in several variations. Refer to the appropriate CAB Section in Group 16 of the Master Service Manual for procedures covering cowl drain trays.
For most other under hood assemblies that may require removal, refer to the appropriate section in GROUP 09 of the Master Service Manual.

caution.para: While handling the thermostatic expansion valve in the following procedures, it is important to keep it and the entire A/C system as dirt free as possible.

note.para: Refer to Figure 21 while performing the following Remove and Install procedures.

step1.para: Discharge A/C system. Refer to DISCHARGING THE SYSTEM .
With top locking plate removed from expansion valve, remove two 3mm Allen head capscrews from expansion valve body. Remove and retain bottom locking plate.

If A/C system is to be flushed or purged, perform that operation before reassembling the system. Refer to PURGING OR FLUSHING THE AIR CONDITIONING SYSTEM
.

note.para: Always lubricate O-rings on fittings with mineral-based oil during installation.

important.para: Before installing new O-rings in the following steps, insure that the old O-rings have been removed.

step1.para: Insure that new lubricated O-rings are installed on all lines being connected to expansion valve.
Position expansion valve on top of evaporator inlet and outlet lines.
Install bottom locking plate and secure to expansion valve with two 3mm Allen head (M5) capscrews. Tighten to 4,000 to 4300 N.mm (35.4 to 38.0 lbf-in).
Insert outlet thermistor line (11, Figure 21) into top of expansion valve (10).
Install top locking plate and secure to expansion valve with T30 Torx head (M6) screw. Tighten to 9,000 to 10,000 N.mm (80 to 90 lbf-in).
Insure that all clamps securing condenser-to-evaporator line (4) to evaporator housing (3) have been installed and tightened.
Install and/or tighten clamp(s) securing evaporator-to-compressor line (1) to cowl.
Install cab cowl tray, if previously raised or removed.
Install right side splash panel, if previously removed.
